definition: one/1/single/a (article)/as soon as/entire/whole/all/throughout/"one" radical in Chinese characters (Kangxi radical 1)/also pr. [yao1] for greater clarity when spelling out numbers digit by digit

sentences.english: Above all, an authoritarian state intolerant of dissent and a one-party political system.
sentences.chinese: 專制國家偏執地使用一黨專制的政治制度。

sentences.english: The earth opened and swallowed up Dathan, and covered the company of Abiram.
sentences.chinese: 地裂開，吞下大坍，掩蓋亞比蘭一黨的人。

sentences.english: Or is he promoting limited internal reforms designed to strengthen one-party rule?
sentences.chinese: 抑或他是在推動旨在加強一黨統治的有限內部改革？

sentences.english: Hard to do with a one-party democracy.
sentences.chinese: 這是一黨民主難以做到的。

sentences.english: It's not wise to put that money under one-party control.
sentences.chinese: 把所有的錢都讓一黨控制的做法很不明智。

sentences.english: His party won the election with a big majority.
sentences.chinese: 他那一黨以高票贏得了選舉。

sentences.english: This do; Take you censers, Korah, and all his company;
sentences.chinese: 可拉阿，你們要這樣行，你和你的一黨要拿香爐來。

sentences.english: for they be all adulterers, an assembly of treacherous men.
sentences.chinese: 因他們都是行姦淫的，是行詭詐的一黨。
